file_content.text: I'm not ready yet! Just tell me when we have to do this and I'll... come out.
Oh, come on! That's not how this was supposed to go!
Still can't roll with the punches. You perfectionist types never learn--there's no such thing as a "sure thing."
Why are we trying to recruit someone who wants to kill you?
This is pointless, Gault.
Because Dretcher's literally the only one I trust to pull this off.
He's the one with the grudge! After I made that body double he went and swindled half of Nar Shaddaa, in my name!
It's taken everything I know to stay hidden in this little prison. Every time I start to think I can leave, someone snitches on my new identities.
Gault....
That true?
So maybe I encouraged Dretcher's early retirement. This little box is cozier than a coffin, and a better place to reflect on how stupid trying to blackmail me was.
But hey, ancient history, am I right? I'm more than willing to forget about our past disagreements, if you do one more job for me.
Like I'd ever help you again!
I can't imagine you want things to continue as they are. You can get your life back. With interest.
The grudge isn't worth it.
More credits than I've made in my entire career, Dretch. You know that's nothing to scoff at.
Listen, Dretcher. I don't know how much you know about life on the outside these days, but it's bad.
Even to save the galaxy?
If you want there to be something left to look forward to when you come out, I need your help.
And if you think it's hard to live under the scanners now, just wait until the Eternal Empire's fully staked their claim on the galaxy.
He's asking, I'm telling. You're going to help us with a heist or I'm going to rip you out of there and beat you within an inch of your life.
Here's how it's going to be.
Hmph, there's twenty-five layers of durasteel and cortosis between you and me. We'll both be dead of old age before you make good on that!
It's true, we might never get into that safe room of yours... but I'm sure this sonic amplifier I brought will have an interesting effect on the contents.
So unless you want to spend your final moments being shaken to death by the dulcet tones of the Kashyyyk Life Day Choir, I'd reconsider.
I'd definitely reconsider.
Not how I'd want to go.
Rrrwargh!
[Wookiee Impression]
Rrwar!
Okay! Okay!
Or maybe I just drop this box off the pier.
There's a simpler method.
Fine! I'll do the stupid job.
Sit tight, Dretch, and get reacquainted with the concept of hygiene. We've got one more stop to make before we get to the fun part.
There have to be laws against this. Broad, intergalactic laws.
This seems cruel and unusual.
This? Nah, maybe a noise ordinance, at best.
